poem:
Title: "Elections in the Balance"

Sunak – daring, gambles on an economy is kneading,
Opinion polls left bleeding, twenty points receding. 
Autumn waits, an ominous leaf-base,
Is this as good as it gets, this fraught race?
PM stares at the chaotic palette, his stance unyielding,
For truth hides in ballot's creases, the tensions unceasing. 
A coin in the air, all bets descending,
Our political loom of deceit ever-extending.
